data.title: Recent News
data.text:
Property & Casualty Insurance

Create innovative P&C insurance programs, streamline data reporting to regulators, and leverage analytics to assess and price risks with speed and precision.

Learn more

Life and Annuities

Refine life, annuity, and pension plans from the individual to the portfolio level, driving value across individual life and annuity lines.

Learn more

Specialty Markets

Compete in new markets with solutions for specialties such as professional liability, management liability, and crime and fidelity.

Learn more

Consumer Insights

Find the right customers at the right time among current and potential auto, home, health, and life policyholders seeking a home and its related services.

Learn more

Real Estate and Mortgage Servicing

Make informed property decisions backed by unparalleled insights and comprehensive data on market values, key property characteristics, and historical trends, all in real time.

Learn more

View All Products

Browse all our available products, across all lines, industries, and stages of the insurance life cycle.

Explore Products

About Verisk

Learn who we are, explore our history as a a strategic partner to the insurance industry, and how we're continuously evolving to support resilience and sustainability for individuals, businesses, and communities.

Learn more

The Extreme Event Solutions group at Verisk estimates industry insured losses to onshore property from wind in the U.S. for Hurricane Beryl will range between USD 2 billion to USD 3 billion.

Verisk will report its financial results for the fiscal second quarter ended June 30, 2024, on Wednesday, July 31, 2024, before the market open.

A relatively high proportion of the overall losses for this event are likely to be insured, owing to the high insurance take up for the flood peril.

Verisk today announced the Reference Yield and Total Consideration, each as summarized in the table and as defined in the Offer to Purchase dated May 21, 2024, to be paid in connection with the previously announced cash tender offer for up to $400,000,000 aggregate principal amount of its 4.000% Senior Notes due 2025.

These fully integrated solutions provide ultra-fast ROI and are designed to transform how global insurers and banks are run by unlocking value across all facets of the business.

This strategic integration revolutionizes the ecosystem for theft-recovery and security of assets and offers unprecedented benefits to businesses across agriculture, construction, and industrial services industries.

According to key financial indicators for private U.S. property/casualty insurers, 2023 followed similar trends in underwriting losses to those seen in a difficult 2022.

Verisk today announced the pricing of an offering of $600 million of 5.250% Senior Notes due 2034.

Verisk today announced that it has commenced a cash tender offer for up to $400,000,000 aggregate principal amount, as may be increased or decreased by the Company, of its 4.000% Senior Notes due 2025.

Mavera’s operations in Sweden support Verisk’s expansion in Europe and its continued growth as a technology and analytics partner to the global insurance industry.
